_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The consequences for the venerables [sn3: Though you were face to face with the Buddha, you overlooked him
Imagining that you should ask me about this matter
That was the time to approach the Buddha and ask about this matter
You should have remembered it in line with the Buddha’s answer
The ways to perceive and conceive the wo: Through the eye in the world
Through the ear in the world
Through the nose in the world
Through the tongue in the world
Through the body in the world
Through the mind in the world
The detailed meaning of the brief passag: It’s not possible to know or see or reach the end of the world by traveling
There’s no making an end of suffering without reaching the end of the world
Whatever in the world through which you perceive the world and conceive the world is called the world in the training of the Noble One.
